instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight and sleep problem
threads.message:
Hello,

This was a liquid damaged unit. I changed <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> and LCD connector.
Now I have backlight. Only problem when I set the brightness it's not smooth, it's not continues.
It's "flashing" laggy when I set the brightness. I didn't really have this problem before.

Only blacklight problem I had it was no backlight, or I could see the leds at the bottom of the LCD.
Changing the backlight sense resistors always solved that, but this is different now.

The second problem is that when it goes to sleep mode, it won't come back, if I press any button on keyboard.
It just comes back if I press the power button. I have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>. 

Thank you.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight and sleep problem
threads.message: First run ASD, this could be sensor issue or ME issue too.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight and sleep problem
threads.message: Please provide short video clip of what this looks like when setting brightness.

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight and sleep problem
threads.message:
ASD test passed(100 test). No sensor issues. I cleaned the ME region anyway, but it didn't solve anything.
I checked the sleep signals and it was weird. I was hoping it's not the PCH. I changed SMC and the sleep problem was resolved.
I changed the LED driver(it came from digikey) from another board and that solve the backlight problem.
I tried to make a video, but I can't really see the backlight problem on the video.

The macbook runs ok now, little bit hot but it's working.

Solved.

Thank you!

threads.title: [SOLVED] <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Backlight and sleep problem
threads.message: We were using the same board at PBRS for LED driver soldering for three months. At the end it looked like a seizure. LED driver can cause this! issues with fset/iset/fltr/etc.  Glad to see it's solved though.
